Notes.—(1) Total amount of currency, including subsidiary notes and coins issued by the Currency Board'up to July, 1950, and thereafter • by the Central Bank. (2) Excludes subsidiary notes and coins. (3) Includes subsidiary notes and coins. (4) Active circulation is arrived at by deducting from Gross circulation, currency held by Government and banks. (5) Excludes deposits owned by banks in Ceylon and banks abroad but includes deposits owned by customers abroad ; also includes the deposits of Government

agencies and institutions with Central Bank from October, 1950. (6) Includes semi-Government deposits up to September, 1949. Thereafter the figures relate to Government deposits only. (7) Total demand deposits minus Inter-bank, Government and semi-Government deposits up to September, 1949 ; thereafter minus Inter-bank and Government
deposits only. (8) Money supply is denned as consisting of all currency and demand deposits owned by persons other than commercial banks or the Government.

The figures for Money Supply from December, 1942 to September, 1949, consist of active circulation (i.e., column 4) : plus demand deposits excluding Government, semi-Government and Inter-bank deposits ( t. c, column 7 ) ; but the figures from December, 1949, consist of active circulation plus demand deposits excluding Government and Inter-bank deposits only, i.e., semi-Government deposits are included. Hence the Money Supply figures before December, 1949, are only roughly comparable with the figures from December, 1949. * For better illustration of the changes, the figures for 1948 and 1949 are shown as at the end of each quarter and the figures for 1950 and 1951 as at the end of each month.

The accounts of the Central Bank of Ceylon for the period 28th August, 1950, to 31st December, 1950, have been audited underfmy direction. I hereby certify as a result of the audit that in my opinion the above Balance Sheet together with the Profit and Loss Account for the period 28th August, 1950, to 31st December, 1950, attached thereto, are properly drawn'up in accordance with the books and records maintained by the Bank and the information and explanations furnished to me, so as to exhibit a correct view of the state of affairs of the aforesaid Bank as at 31st December, 1950.
P. W. KAULE, for Auditor-General. 29th March, 1951.

Total Amount Amount % of Total Expenditure
" Revenue " as shown in this statement excludes credits of an extraordinary nature, such as recovery from Loan Funds of sums advanced in previous years and Surplus in Sinking Fund.
" Expenditure " as shown in this statement excludes debits of an extraordinary nature, such as sums advanced from Revenue and chargeable to Loan Funds in subsequent i years.
'' Loan Expenditure " includes not only expenditure from Loan Funds but also advances from Revenue for. loan works pending raising of loans.

(a) Includes Rs. 174.4 million as food subsidies up to September 30, 1948, of which Rs. 96.6 million, represent the net cost of subsidies financed outside the budget ! during the previous financial years.
